verses.kjv: Woe to them that are at ease in Zion, and trust in the mountain of Samaria, which are named chief of the nations, to whom the house of Israel came!
verses.web: Woe to those who are at ease in Zion, and to those who are secure on the mountain of Samaria, the notable men of the chief of the nations, to whom the house of Israel come!
verses.ct: Disaster is coming for those who live comfortably in Zion and for those who feel safe on the mountain of Samaria — the prominent leaders of the foremost nation, to whom the people of Israel turn!

verses.kjv: Pass ye unto Calneh, and see; and from thence go ye to Hamath the great: then go down to Gath of the Philistines: be they better than these kingdoms? or their border greater than your border?
verses.web: Go to Calneh, and see; and from there go to Hamath the great; then go down to Gath of the Philistines. are they better than these kingdoms? or is their border greater than your border?
verses.ct: Go look at Calneh. Then travel to the great city of Hamath. Then go down to Gath of the Philistines. Are those kingdoms really better off than yours? Is their territory larger than yours?

verses.kjv: Ye that put far away the evil day, and cause the seat of violence to come near;
verses.web: Those who put far away the evil day, and cause the seat of violence to come near;
verses.ct: You push the thought of disaster out of your minds, yet by your actions you invite violence to your doorstep.

verses.kjv: That lie upon beds of ivory, and stretch themselves upon their couches, and eat the lambs out of the flock, and the calves out of the midst of the stall;
verses.web: Who lie on beds of ivory, and stretch themselves on their couches, and eat the lambs out of the flock, and the calves out of the middle of the stall;
verses.ct: You lounge on beds inlaid with ivory and sprawl across your couches. You feast on the choicest lambs from the flock and the fattest calves from the stall.

verses.kjv: That chant to the sound of the viol, and invent to themselves instruments of musick, like David;
verses.web: who strum on the strings of a harp; who invent for themselves instruments of music, like David;
verses.ct: You strum away on your harps and dream up new instruments like David did.

verses.kjv: That drink wine in bowls, and anoint themselves with the chief ointments: but they are not grieved for the affliction of Joseph.
verses.web: who drink wine in bowls, and anoint themselves with the best oils; but they are not grieved for the affliction of Joseph.
verses.ct: You gulp wine by the bowlful and slather yourselves with the finest oils — but you don't lose a moment's sleep over the ruin of Joseph's descendants.

verses.kjv: Therefore now shall they go captive with the first that go captive, and the banquet of them that stretched themselves shall be removed.
verses.web: Therefore they will now go captive with the first who go captive; and the feasting and lounging will end.
verses.ct: So you will be the very first to go into exile. Your days of feasting and lounging are over.

verses.kjv: The Lord GOD hath sworn by himself, saith the LORD the God of hosts, I abhor the excellency of Jacob, and hate his palaces: therefore will I deliver up the city with all that is therein.
verses.web: “The Lord LORD has sworn by himself,” says LORD, the God of Armies: “I abhor the pride of Jacob, and detest his fortresses. Therefore I will deliver up the city with all that is in it.
verses.ct: The Lord GOD has sworn by himself — this is what the LORD, the God of Armies, declares: "I despise the pride of Jacob and hate his fortresses. I will hand over the city and everything in it."

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, if there remain ten men in one house, that they shall die.
verses.web: It will happen, if there remain ten men in one house, that they shall die.
verses.ct: If 10 men are left in a single house, every one of them will die.

verses.kjv: And a man’s uncle shall take him up, and he that burneth him, to bring out the bones out of the house, and shall say unto him that is by the sides of the house, Is there yet any with thee? and he shall say, No. Then shall he say, Hold thy tongue: for we may not make mention of the name of the LORD.
verses.web: “When a man’s relative carries him, even he who burns him, to bring bodies out of the house, and asks him who is in the innermost parts of the house, ‘Is there yet any with you?’ And he says, ‘No;’ then he will say, ‘Hush! Indeed we must not mention LORD’s name.’
verses.ct: When a relative comes with the one who burns the bodies to carry the dead out of the house, he'll call to anyone still inside, "Is anyone left with you?" The answer will come back, "No one." Then he'll say, "Quiet! We must not even speak the name of the LORD."

verses.kjv: For, behold, the LORD commandeth, and he will smite the great house with breaches, and the little house with clefts.
verses.web: “For, behold, LORD commands, and the great house will be smashed to pieces, and the little house into bits.
verses.ct: Look — the LORD gives the command, and the great house will be smashed to rubble and the small house shattered to pieces.

verses.kjv: Shall horses run upon the rock? will one plow there with oxen? for ye have turned judgment into gall, and the fruit of righteousness into hemlock:
verses.web: Do horses run on the rocky crags? Does one plow there with oxen? But you have turned justice into poison, and the fruit of righteousness into bitterness;
verses.ct: Do horses gallop across rocky cliffs? Does anyone plow the sea with oxen? Yet you have turned justice into poison and the fruit of righteousness into something bitter.

verses.kjv: Ye which rejoice in a thing of nought, which say, Have we not taken to us horns by our own strength?
verses.web: you who rejoice in a thing of nothing, who say, ‘Haven’t we taken for ourselves horns by our own strength?’
verses.ct: You celebrate over nothing and boast, 'Haven't we gained power by our own strength?'

verses.kjv: But, behold, I will raise up against you a nation, O house of Israel, saith the LORD the God of hosts; and they shall afflict you from the entering in of Hemath unto the river of the wilderness.
verses.web: For, behold, I will raise up against you a nation, house of Israel,” says LORD, the God of Armies; “and they will afflict you from the entrance of Hamath to the brook of the Arabah.”
verses.ct: "But watch — I am raising up a nation against you, house of Israel," declares the LORD, the God of Armies. "They will crush you from the entrance of Hamath all the way down to the brook of the Arabah."
